Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
This Kinder Camp program provides a safe variety of activities designed to incorporate the BYU-Idaho learning model. All activities are supervised by trained, responsible staff. An integral part of the daily activities include socialization and character development through crafts, games and outdoor play.

Approximately twenty minutes have been allocated for each activity. (Excluding field trips, special activities, etc.)

Crafts

  • Help build and expand a child's imagination
  • Improve hand-eye coordination and fine-motor control
  • Help with the development of both visual and verbal planning skills.
  • Allow children to express themselves creatively and achieve a sense of accomplishment and self worth

"Art is a process. Art is more than paper and crayons, and pots of paint. Instead, it is a way to put things together and make them work in a pleasing way." -Eric Booth

Games

During cooperative play, children work together and strive to achieve a common goal.

"Children use their minds while playing, because they are thinking and acting as if they were another person. When they make such a transformation, they are taking a step toward abstract thinking in that they are freeing their thoughts from a focus on concrete object." -Lilly Ryan

Outdoor Play

Outdoor play stresses exploration and risk-taking. Because of this children gain confidence and assurance in themselves. It allows children to learn in ways they cannot indoors. Outdoor play teaches children the importance of social skills, communication and cooperation.
